body.p: To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky:
Your petitioner James Hasson states that at the April Term of the he was fined by said Court the sum of twenty dollars for selling liquor on the Fair Ground in said County -- Mason Circuit Court 1861

To the Indictment therefore, he plead guilty but at the time he committed the offense he did not know the same was forbidden by law -- He is poor, having a family to support and driving a Dray in the City of Maysville for livelihood, the payment of the fine would be a great hardship upon him and detract in these times greatly from his means of support, he most respectfully prays you to remit said fine its infliction being indeed being to him a salutary admonition for the future to beware

Mason Cir. Ct
James Hasson's Petition,

If remitted, please hand remitter to
John L. Scott.
